page.title: 20Conclusion
page.content:
CONCLUSION The area we have described is part of the Metropolitan Borough of Sefton within Merseyside County.The locality is known as Crosby,originally Crosebi derived from two Norse words krossa and byr meaning the settlement or village with crosses.Our area is centred on Waterloo,known as Crosby Seabank in earlier days and where in 1815 the Waterloo Hotel(now Royal )was built at the time of the famous battle. The information has been collected by three local schools : STREATHAM HOUSE SCHOOL ST.JOHN'S C.E.PRIMARY,WATERLOO ST.NICHOLAS C.E.PRIMARY,BLUNDELLSANDS
July,1985.
